<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!-->


**What happened**:
When run kubelet with "--cpu-cfs-quota-period 1000ms"  and without --feature-gates=CustomCPUCFSQuotaPeriod=true, kubelet would set cgroup cpu.cfs_period_us to 1000000, but make calculation based on a default value of 100000, this means if a pod has a limit of 100m, it would have a quota of 10000,  causing its limit set to 10m actually.

**What you expected to happen**:
If the cfs gate is not enabled, the "--cpu-cfs-quota-period" option should not take effect at all.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Start kubelet with "--cpu-cfs-quota-period 1000ms", and run a pod with limit set to some value, then the pod's runtime limit, which is only 10%.

**Anything else we need to know?**:
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/9ce03717a90f9482436b85b512ee482374c57880/pkg/kubelet/cm/helpers_linux.go#L61-L63
The code above reset the period to default when calculating quota, but the runtime period is not reset.
